meanings.definition: To stare fiercely or angrily at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She outglared the bully who was bothering her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outglared the students to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat outglared the dog in a playful staring contest.
meanings.sent4: His eyes outglared the darkness of the night, searching for any movement.
meanings.sent5: The outglaring look from her mother made him realize he was in trouble.

meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The sun outglared all the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks outglared the city lights for a moment.
meanings.sent3: The neon sign outglared the moon, making it seem dim in comparison.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outglared the shining diamond on her finger.
meanings.sent5: The outglaring light from the lighthouse guided the ships safely to shore.
